title: How to Analyze the Book Competition for your Niche and Keyword

tactics.name: Competition Search Analysis
tactics.description: Use KDP Rocket to identify top-ranking books for a keyword and assess competitiveness
steps: Click competition search buttons in KDP Rocket
Analyze top books ranked for the keyword
Evaluate factors like BSR, reviews, and pricing
caveats: Results may differ from Amazon due to lack of account/geo data
source_quotes: Amazon bestseller rank or ABSR is one of the strongest indications of competitiveness

heuristics.name: Low Review Threshold
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize the keyword
source_quotes: If you see lots of books that are older than a year but have Amazon bestseller ranks better than 90-thousand then you know they've got a stronghold in the market

claims.statement: KDP Rocket provides a pure list of top-ranking books without account-specific data
source_quotes: KDP Rocket isn't attached to any particular account or geolocation

niche_patterns.description: Target underserved niches with specific identity, problem, and constraint combinations
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Creates unique value propositions with lower competition
source_quotes: If you notice that none of the books in this list have your keyword in them but have a lot of sales then this too could mean that the book has a popular author
